intro: Geigeria appendiculata, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Geigeria appendiculata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
